page.title: 04Bonneyhale Mushroom Farm
page.content: The farm(ref.04800411) is owned by 3 brothers. They bought a farm house and 0.2 hectares of land at Ealand Warpings 6 years ago and they started in the old coalhouse(now the packing room) and from that they built seven large dome-shaped growing rooms. They employ 8 full-time and 13 part-time workers. {The process} Wooden palettes 1.22m. square are filled with specially treated horse manure compost.The palettes are taken to the peak-heat room where the compost is pasteurised. This room holds 140 palettes containing 19.3 tonnes of compost.The room is insulated and kept at a temperature of 115 degrees celsius(C). There are air vents at the side through which fresh air is circulated. The palettes are left for a week.They are taken to the spawn-running room.
